PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The corresponding LUMO energy levels were calculated from the HOMO energy level and the onset absorption of polymers in thin films , which were -4.01 , -4.11 , -4.11 , and -4.16 eV , respectively.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| HOMO energy level |
| LUMO energy level of the first polymer |
| LUMO energy level of the second polymer |
| LUMO energy level of the third polymer |
| LUMO energy level of the fourth polymer |
| Onset absorption of the first polymer in thin films | -4.01 eV |
| Onset absorption of the second polymer in thin films | -4.11 eV |
| Onset absorption of the third polymer in thin films | -4.11 eV |
| Onset absorption of the fourth polymer in thin films | -4.16 eV |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| HOMO energy level |
| LUMO energy level of the first polymer | -4.01 eV |
| LUMO energy level of the second polymer | -4.11 eV |
| LUMO energy level of the third polymer | -4.11 eV |
| LUMO energy level of the fourth polymer | -4.16 eV |

These entities are material properties, specifically the energy levels of the Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital (HOMO) and the Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital (LUMO) for each polymer, and the onset absorption energies for each polymer in thin films.
